google_play_reviews.content: Love it.
Joplin for desktop is top notch, Joplin for Android has it's limits, but with the desktop app behind it's still 4*
what is the "microphone" permission request for in the latest update?
Switched from desktop Evernote because of frequent urges to update to versions I did not like; use Joplin synced between android phone and desktop. What an improvement!
A good app, too bad it lacks the nested notebooks feature that exists on the desktop app
Joplin is simply the best! Great synching across devices and a rich authoring environment. One little wishlist item... Indenting would be a great function. Is that possible?
A love that it is cross platform / cross syncing. Simple and dependable.
Please add following features: 1. Different section for To-do list 2. Home screen widget for To-do list

REQUEST: Please add 'Undo' & 'Redo' functionality to the app, it is essential! I have migrated from Evernote, after using it for more than 13 years! It was a hard decision but I'm glad I did. Joplin is amazing, noticed a major performance difference. Best feature I like is not enabling double-tap to edit notes! That gives pieces of mind that I don't accidentally alter something. Cheers to the Joplin devs.
Best notes app. Syncs to cloud storage providers and with E2E encryption
The only thing I want this app to have to fully replace any other note-taking app is to be able to handwrite notes.

One year into Joplin; one of the best experiences ever. Android app does leave quite a lot of room for improvement, but if you use the desktop Joplin app, see the Android version as a companion where you can quickly view your notes. A downside I wish to see fixed in a future update is the note lag which becomes apparent the more you type in a note and when the note is also long. Either way this is a wonderful app in general.

I downloaded this to replace Google Keep and OneNote. I guess I'll just keep those, because this app is really confusing and difficult to use. Creating a checklist was the first thing I needed to do, and it was impossible. The add checklist button adds 1 checkbox. There's no obvious option to add more. There are guides, but I don't think I should have to read multiple pages-long guides I order to use a simple note taking app.
Best now taking app. Period

It is open source and actively developed, but still needs major optimization on Android. Note taking takes several clicks too many and the editor doesn't scroll well or seek to previously edited areas. The app becomes unusable with big notes. Spell check is locked to selected phone language so for us who write in several languages it is an impractical mess. Super slow synchronization and no background service - you have to keep the app in foreground, screen on, to synchronize. It needs better.
Loving it!
Had issue connecting to Joplin Cloud, but after resetting my password a couple times I got it to work. So far, enjoying the app. Should be very useful.

Joplin generally, and this app in particular, are fantastic. Excellent synchronization through my own personal Nextcloud means I'm never beholden to any company for my notes. The android client is well done, stable, and seems as feature complete as the desktop application. Synchronization is fantastic! My notes are with me on-the-go and always exportable to open formats.

AMAZING APP. Besides free, its open source, E2EE and self hosted. I will be making a donation shortly. One issue is that there isn't other colors to highlight, only yellow. It will be great if you can add different colors

Previous updates have been great. Custom Order still doesn't work. Drag and drop does not function. Cursor detection is awful. Buggy as hell. Years-old GitHub threads are closed, issues claiming to be fixed‚Äîwell, they're not fixed or they've been rebroken. Great features compared to alternatives but this thing needs to be rebuilt from the ground up.
Great simple notes app. Very easy to sync between the computer and the app easy to take a note and later see it on the computer
poor synchronisation
Doesn't sync unless I open the app. Despite setting an hourly sync schedule and allowing background operations every time I open the app I have to sync it or I have old notes.
The Android app is about as basic as you can get, and it doesn't work sometimes. Literally All you can do is take notes. Nothing else whatsoever.
It's perfect now! I'm very happy with it. Every thing is working as intended and the new changes have made it a pleasure to use. Very solid app, and Free and open source! I love it
Powerful note taking app while easy to use. I use it across multiple devices and it works very well.
Very good . I left Notion and Switched to Joplin.
This app has been getting more love lately
Great app for notes and supports Dropbox sync. It will be better if there is view option for showing body text at note lost.

I really like the updates where you have a toolbar at the bottom which really helps to make our job more effectively. The one I love the most is the ability to add a checkbox button with only two clicks. In the previous version, I really have to type these symbols out - [ ] one by one on my phone and it was really really tedious. I almost looked for an alternative but I stay because of the updates. Keep up the good works! Thanks üëçüëç
better and better
I love this app! I've tested several apps for notes and Joplin is excellent, clean and supports tons of notes. It's cloud agnostic, so you can use different cloud provides to synchronise.

Overall this is a great app allowing for access to notes via the cloud, and at coverting screen shots and web pages into actual working, detailed, editable notes. However the developers are lying about End-to-End-Encryption (EEE). EEE is defined as being encrypted upon and independantly from both end devices and while in transit between those devices. Joplin only encrypts while in transit, leaving data on your devices unencrypted and vulnerable. THAT IS NOT EEE! You data is not protected.

I've tried a lot of notes apps and ended up choosing Joplin. The clincher was having a desktop application as this can make it easier when editing. It lacks some features (such as locking individual notes or notebooks) but it's fairly easy to use. Wish it synchronised to Google Drive but there are several options including OneDrive.
Great for self hosting!
Can we have export to .pdf, .md and .html functions on Android app too?
Should have made easy backup available for non cloud users
There is nothing better than Joplin in the free, open source and cross platform space. It's my favourite note taking app.
Free and open source! Great community! Love the newest updates.
Why the sync on phone takes ages? It is so infuriating...
No recycle bin or trash folder after deleting a note or notebook.

This is an incredibly rich featured note taking application. The only thing I would ask is that on a to-do list item, to make it easier to tap the check mark box; I am continuously tapping slightly to the right of it so I end up editing instead of marking it as checked off.
never had problems with synching, which was my biggest problem while using other apps. it would be 5 stars if only there were some plugins on the smartphone too
Sync between ALL devices!! (Free or paid!)
Best open source note taking app.
Very good! But secure access with password is a need.
The recent update has everything I was expecting.
Great app so far. Needs an option to archive/hide selected notes.

I'm struggling for hours to sync all my devices over onedrive. With every new device, it keeps creating a new folder target on onedrive with every device syncing to its own folder and not to a single one wich btw cannot be selected. I have all my notes in this app but unfortunately will have to look for something else.
(15 Mar) A few weeks ago, it suddenly launched to blank screen and nothing else, the only way I fixed it was to reinstall the app. Just now, it happened again. (Today, 19 March) Happened again.
Super cool! Privacy and open source forever. Mobile apps are slowly improving but he desktop app is killer

Free crossdevice sync which obsidian doesn't have. Desktop version can be enriched with useful plugins for maximizing the Zettlekasten method (quick links, graph, backlinks, zoplin ai). smartphone version has limited capabilities in comparison (not being able to use plugins for example) I would request a Reminder for repeated tasks feature.we would be able to use it as a todo app also,then.
Has always been a good app. Last update made it great, much better editing, love it!

Getting better Been using this for a while now and I would have rated it 3*. This last update brought it closer to 4*. Now being able to scroll quickly in edit mode is a major improvement for what I use it for. Now it just needs to stop jumping around when I click the edit button. Before it would jump to the bottom, now it's a bit random. At least I can quickly get to where I need. The new edit tools are also a step in the right direction.
Migrated from Evernote to Joplin several month ago. Joplin is excellent, especially in privacy.

I wanted NotesApp with RichText feature & Joplin has but justfor pc.What it lacks is stopping me to use it on Mobile. Like, 1. No RichText only on MobileApp. Hate Markdown 2. There is an option for custom order for arranging notes, but it doesn't work. We should be able to Drag and Rearrange order to our liking. 3. Lineheight is a little more than what i would prefer, and there is no option to change that. 4. Mobile App is so Slow. 5. Why there is default pop-up for Geolocation? Who needs that?

Great app, but no longer working on my S22 ultra. Its been buggy for weeks crashing and now doesn't start, just a black screen. Clearing cache, reinstalling didn't help. I will revise this review and donate if it gets fixed. Shame, because this is otherwise one the best crossplatform productivity apps out there.
Latest update= even better. Really love the addition of the formatting toolbar and the ease of making check lists now! Thank you!

A good privacy friendly open source markdown note app. Feature request : 1Ô∏è‚É£A render button at bottom right corner. 2Ô∏è‚É£Show all markdown buttons in markdown editor(inline). 3Ô∏è‚É£Custom markdown button position(inline).

Fast and simple for syncing PC / laptop /mobile notes. For android annoying issue i have is for long notes: when editing , cursor always goes to the bottom of the note,  so it  takes many swipes before i reach the top for editing ... normally  it should be editing where i'm viewing the note .

Initially I had a huge number of issues connecting Joplin to Nextcloud. However after a couple of updates, connection stability is now rock solid. It has since rapidly become my main note jotter app. Would now highly recommend.
Best diary note app i ever used

Joplin is a great app, and I love the ability to sync files using Syncthing. However, file permissions do not work on Android with the latest upgrade (only media file permissions are selectable), so I needed to downgrade to 2.4.3. I look forward to this issue being resolved!

It syncs nicely to a number of possible storage media including WebDAV. So I can use it from multiple devices and store to a NAS. This is an important feature to me. Unfortunately the Android app is so poorly done that it is hardly usable except for a few very short notes. Search functionality is pathetic and the more time you spend in edit mode the slower it gets, to seconds before a single character appears. Too bad, this could have been really good.

Almost great! It's the best among open source alternatives for all I know but falls short of propriety note takers in how it's implemented. Syncing and encryption are especially not intuitive. I still choose it over anything else but wish the dev had a broader definition of usability.

It‚Äôs decent. Little rough around the edges, had some scares with notes possibly being deleted and not syncing right through dropbox. Seems like it works fine now though. Just keep very frequent backups, seriously.
I think it's a great app for notes the developers did an amazing job at creating a simple but detailed app I highly recommend it and thanks for the app creator

Because the system can have multiple clients you have to approach note encryption with caution; one client at a time. Apart from that; what's not to like. Markdown, attachments, plugins, sync and search.
Excellent. Even still has some problems. But it's free and keep fix.
A great note app that meets my needs. Using it cross platform as I move away from Apple
buggy
Amazing companion for the desktop app.

Works well. But my main issue is the Looks and Interface of the app. It looks very dated, even for current Android standards where material theme has gotten better. The app's appearance should be pleasing to the eye and look modern like other note taking apps.
App keeps crashing and no alternative cloud providers. I use the app to take notes of phrases in different language but, every time I switch between apps, it keeps crashing.
Great stuff, webdav sync works like a charm
Great app, at least considering the constraints of electron. Although a widget would be a nice feature to have.
Clean interface. It does what exactly it offers. Encryption option is a cool plus.
amazing app allowing to manage notes out of GAFA's world
The app on a whole works very well. One complaint I have is that I can't create nested folders, or move folders around
It just has all the features I need: open source, cross-platform, arbitrarily deep hierarchical organization, markdown support. Love it. (Using it with Joplin Cloud)

I see this service going places so I'll keep it and see how it develops. The sync works great (I have it using onedrive), search is responsive and quick and it's open source with increasing adoption which is good to see. I wish it switched between dark and light mode automatically and I look forward to a better wisywig editor.
Great substitute for Evernote. I love I can sync all my devices to my nextcloud.
V. Good app

Open source, great app, easy to setup multi device sync with a diy s3 bucket, or you can just pay them for it. Either way it works great Sharing to the app works great, also tap and hold menu. Good stuff.
Horrible sync function. Syncing with OneDrive deleted all my notes. When I went to use my backup note on my file system it proceeded to delete them too. Thank you for deleting all my notes.
Please add a pin lock. Please improve feature parity to match desktop editor.
The search is to weak...

Without "unnecessary permission" of location for geolocation (why), this app won't work properly with constant popup after pop-ups. Lacks of other sync cloud options (like no option for mega cloud, pcloud or ant other cloud) when its own is broken and not that well developed for quick, fast users. Clunky app, crashes if left for another. Add notes in the title because I can't find via searching. Settings changed, can't see them applied (floppy icon is unnoticeable). Dev knows where to work now.

Easy to use, it's Ok alternative of Evernote but need to improve application, like must give options of text editing like bold highlight underline etc.. etc.. like Evernote. Thank u. Hope next update brings changes in application.

Best things about it is that it is open source notes app with folders & tags. It is quick even with long notes (notes with more than 1,50,000 characters which Color Notes app refuses to handle). Was excited to find convert to todo feature but rather than providing ability to create a checklist with multiple items, all it does is adding a checkbox to the title. Another disappointment comes when I see multiple encryption keys. The app does not help in deciding which keys are safe to delete.
The best note-taking app, hands down. Sync across all devices, including terminal access.
Edit: fixed
Very useful note app
Just optimize the Sync system, people will use it for sure.

I love the desktop app, but unfortunately this mobile app doesn't sync.. it looks like the sync stops when the screen turns off (I checked the power settings and the app is allowed to stay turned on). And even when I wait it out, if I open Joplin again - it looks like it went back in time and unsynced itself and has to sync up again. Weird. I'm using OneDrive btw and set the sync to max 1 simultaneous connection because I'm aware of some reported OneDrive limitations / issues.
I migrated to Joplin after the Evernote rewrite and I works much better for me.
needs to be able to copy code snippets to clipboard with icon click
A great alternative to Evernote. I would like to have an option to organize tags hierarchically and option to select where a notebook is created.

All is well, except one thing. For some reason, twxt input in this app is really slow. The bigger the text is, the slower it types in. Therefore, the app becomes a disaster to use when writing long pieces of text. That does not happen in other apps on my phone. Are there any unneccessary checks or subroutines running each time I add a letter to a note? If so, I'm quite sure the app doesn't need them.
There is no option for highliting text. Please add this feature otherwise great app.

Big thanks to the developer(s)! This app is so useful and lovely. What makes it really great: firstly, this is a notesystem that works. In my experience do most other, moore widely /commercialy used note app not work, at least not from some point on. Secondly, it is reliably. Thirdly, it is open source. Fourthly, notes-syncing with win, linux, mac, android. I use it for all kinds, also for storing my docs- and email templates (through "share" template-note to mailapp). Web-clipper available.
App is great on pc but on mobile is so laggy with big files

Joplin doesn't appear to want to sync EXISTING files/folders created prior to the first synchronization between the Android and Windows applications when used in collaboration with SyncThing. I created files on one device, setup synchronization with the other device following and the prior created files/folders wouldn't synchronize. I had to edit them with new information, save them, re-synchronize them and THEN they showed up on the other device. NEWLY created files on either device sync fine.

Very interesting idea but very weird design on android and not a great Markdown experience. Why doesn't it use swipes, material design and seems to have custom menus that emulate IOS design? Can I use a WYSIWYG editor? Are there quick Markdown buttons for things like lists? A cheatsheet maybe?
Undoubtedly the best note taking app.
Donated to this app, no regrets. I appreciate that joplin is open source, and is not one of those apps that tack on user accounts for the sake of hoovering up user data. Cheers.
Was always good, but the updates over the past year or so have improved usability greatly. Awesome work, guys!
Good

Great app for keeping markdown notes! Syncs and works across all my devices. Only pain point I've experienced is on Android, after writing longer notes, the editor/cursor starts lagging immensely. Exiting and entering the editor again seems to resolve for a little while..
Works well - the phone app works well, but for me, the best thing is they have a command line app that runs on my Linux computers.

After upgrading from Android 8.1.0 to an Android 10 system I experienced an unacceptable degradation in usability of the Evernote app so I went looking for alternatives. Of the many alternatives I've examined, Joplin is the most promising. I'm using a free 8GB Nextcloud account I got from nd.nl.tab.digital as a webdav server, and this enables me to use Joplin on multiple systems. Importing from Evernote was relatively painless. And best of all, its open source.
Superb app. Allows you you synch your notes on any number of devices, and it's Open Source (so no ads).
Great alternative to tools like Evernote. Desperately needs at least a basic undo/redo in the text editor though.
Amazing app, but there is no option of importing JEX file in import..
You can't even create a note without giving the app permission to use my location info. Why would you need to know my location?
pictures keeps on disappearing from view üòÖ
Great open source now taking app! Can also synchronize all your devices by backing up your (encrypted) notes against a cloud server

When the app shows only one character per second while typing, and then somehow loses characters in the buffer, outputting only gibberish after 10 seconds of waiting... it's time to uninstall. I really want to like and use this app, but when the basic functionality isn't there...I guess I'm still looking for a good cross-platform, open source, Evernote replacement.

It has its quirks but has a very active community of coders contributing to the project. Don't make a mistake and utilize OneNote or EverNote and then be rammed to the side when they change the platform and you nice neat organized notes are broken. Google Keep is good option for everyday I don't care if Google knows about my info for sports but for anything like company data or anything in general you plan to grow out into an actual note taking app, this is the one.
Promising but full of annoying flaws.
Amazing app, way better than onenote.

Amazingly good note taking app (and I have used almost everything that was supposed to be good). Thanks to all the developers and supporters who made this happen. This is an extremely powerful, elegantly simple app that seems to have almost no limits! It does not do absolutely everything (but it almost does) and it's absolutely beautiful work by the development team...üëç
The best app I have tried. I need it in F-Droid

I've tried _most_ of the top rated apps for markdown. Joplin, IMO, is the best available. It has better support for the format and the preview/reader is excellent. The only thing missing from the mobile app is the ability to import *.md files (it's in the desktop version). If you're looking for a markdown reader/editor **you have to try Joplin**!

Great for privacy; it's FOSS, you self-host notes and you control the data. But the mobile app is far too feature poor and lag-prone. WYSIWYG not implemented. Automatic bullets in lists not supported. No live previews of markdowns. Mobile is an afterthought. Great for minimalistic, no frills, notes, but that's it. Use desktop app for a better experience.
Needs desktop widgets and some general UI/UX improvements.

Amazing service for free, but this app needs some work. It is often laggy, could use a swipe on the left side to get to the sidebar instead of reaching for the hamburger menu. When you first tap to place the cursor in edit mode, the cursor gets placed at the bottom. I wish it went where I tapped because I don't always want to start typing at the bottom.

Super convenient note taking app! Actually my favorite. Synchronization, encryption, cross platform, open source, constant development, FREE... The goodies are just endless. Thank you for this priceless peace of software!
Death to Evernote :)
Best note app ever made. Simply better than Google keep, Evernote, etc. Security + Simplicity = Joplin
The desktop app is great, but the mobile version could do with more QOL/accessibility features like scalable UI and plugins. Also the framerate can be very slow on longer notes.
Absolutely incredible application, I was searching was a good evernote alternative for long time with cross platform support and this is eve better.
Awesome application, incredible sync capabilities. If you're looking for an open source tool for your notes, this is it.
Excellent cross-platform utility. Gives the user control of where notes are stored - Dropbox is a natural choice.

Would be the perfect note taking app for me IF it wouldn't always lag my phone so hard after I've done a bit of writing in the app... meaning: the keyboard can't follow my typing, not only in Joplin but in all other writing apps! It gets worse until I close down Joplin and restart the phone. What a pity! A minor issue for me is that it always opens up notes for editing at the bottom and in long notes it takes ages to move back to the top... If these two things could be fixed... Perfect app ;)

I really want to like it, but the Android app feels like an afterthought, and it's not very polished. I'm coming over from Standard Notes because Joplin offers a lot more functionality like bullet points, checklists, media, etc. but the Android app doesn't offer a ribbon bar with the option to use these features. Instead, you must memorize the text formatting such as **this** for bold text or *this* for italicized text, which seems very old-fashioned. Sliding in from the left doesn't pull out the sidebar like you would expect which is something you must do regularly, as the sync button is in this sidebar. Instead, you must press the button at the top left which gets annoying if you have a large phone because it's a two-handed process. The status bar is a dark gray color with black text (a bit hard to read, especially outdoors) instead of just conforming to the selected theme, and the sync button wouldn't give me the prompt to connect to the Dropbox until I uninstalled and reinstalled to set the app back up (there is no option to open the prompt yourself as far as I'm aware). The overall app design doesn't really follow the material design language either, but it does get the job done. In comparison to Standard Notes, Joplin's multi-device syncing is very slow. It will automatically sync no sooner than every 5 minutes unless you manually hit the sync button, which is fine if you like to use one device at a time, but I'm so used to the instantaneous syncing in Standard Notes where I can paste a link using my phone and see it on my computer within a couple of seconds that I just don't think Joplin is a worthy replacement. It would not hurt to try Joplin, especially because it's completely free and open-source, but it's hard to recommend because there are so many better options like OneNote or Evernote that most people would enjoy more.
Great productivity software!! I have been using joplin since around october 2019. Quite fast sync with dropbox. I don't have any issue until now.
A good and awesome app.

I absolutely love this app! I've been trying to find an alternative to it but I haven't been able to. The only reason I feel the need to replace it is because I can only type or dictate three to five notes without my phone lagging incredibly hard and having to restart my phone. It's enough to make me turn from my favorite notetaking app to something subpar just so it doesn't kill my phone.

Fantastic note taking app. Offers good functionality. Files can be encrypted and synced through Dropbox, so you can easily access all your stuff on any platform without worrying about security. The ability to use markdown offers a wide range of utility.
Excellent note app with syncing..
so far, only one glaring error that I've found seems to be that Joplin does NOT report that it's not connected to the internet. So, you synchronise, and it looks as though it's working, BUT IT ISN'T
Very bad app. In android cannot import md files.
Not very functional on Android. Synchronize takes forever and doesn't get all the notes
The app is cool but it uses Node.js
After I changed nextcloud sync location: desktop app synced like a charm, but on android I see only error "permission denied: cannot create folder". Wiping app data and cache helped :\
Wonderful. For most people this is going to be superior to Evernote.

I love Joplin because it allows complete OFFLINE existence unlike Notion, Onenote or Evernote without upgrade. Secondly it is FOSS. The only letdown is sometimes MARKDOWN is too basic and feels limited.

Joplin's mark-down note taking capabilites are my favorite - hands down. However, I've come across enough "features" while trying to sync encryption across all my devices (consistent banner informing me of improper encryption password settings) to avoid the encryption all together.

This is a useful and interesting app on the desktop but the syncing to Android is a nightmare. If you are coming from Evernote, and have a substantial collection of notes, be prepared to lose hours on the first sync. Joplin on android only syncs in the foreground and only while the phone is awake. So the first thing to do is to get hold of an app like screenon which will keep the phone awake while the first long sync gets under way. Then resign yourself to not being able to use the phone for anything else for the next few hours. I'm writing this four hours after starting a sync of 10,000 notes through dropbox, and with at least an hour to go. Webdav and onedrive are reportedly even slower. There is a dedicated Joplin sync server under development but for the moment you need to be comfortable with docker and github to get it working. Once the first sync is done, subsequent ones seem to happen at reasonable speeds, because only changed files are moved. But the only practical way I can see to transfer a substantial collection of notes to the phone is to let the sync process run overnight. Apart from that, this is an impressive app on the desktop, where it imported 10,000 notes from Evernote in less than half an hour. The use of Markdown makes for much smaller, lighter files, and , if you're used to it, pretty much faff-free editing. There is an impressive ecosystem of plugins to extend its functionality and helpful online community. It has an excellent webclipper for desktop use. If you don't already have a large investment in other note taking systems it's well worth looking at Joplin. But this is a review of the Android app, and the syncing failures really drag it down.
Awesome. The best note taking app ever! I only wish there is a widget to show you a specific note, something like Omninotes.

I LOVE this app. I have it on all of my devices. I use it for all of my recipes, shopping lists, and general notes. It's really just the best note taking app out there. And it allows you to encrypt your entire collection of notes. Icing on the cake is it's open source.
Why it needs location?

Love this app! Only one thing that bugs me: Why is that on the phone app, attached video files are showing blank previews/thumbnails? It works flawlessly in the desktop app and I'd love to see the same for the mobile app as well. Is there anything one can do to fix this? Or are there plans to make this happen natively in future versions?

2 things wanted to see in the following updates: 1. Able to create/manage sub-notebooks and entries with an easy-to-use UI 2 Full note-export functions as PC clients (export to pictures, docx, PDF etc.) It is a great app, but these two things are the HUGE DOWNSIDES, really wanted these features to be added in the next update üôèüôèüôè

I give the Windows desktop version a 5, but for Android, I have to take off a star because it doesn't support straight-up wysiwyg editing. I'm a techie but I don't like to think in markup mode when I'm adding/editing household to-do's, for example. On the big plus side, being able to sync to-do's between my desktop and my Android device, with end-to-end encryption, is just an amazing thing, especially that it's open-source and free.
Please add a widget.
Needs sync with GitHub!
Availabe on all platforms
Awesome
The best. Please update the UI, it's look some old.

While I do feel this app could do more in terms of client side encryption and possibly biometric protection (my phone allows me to set this per app anyway), it is still the best option for note taking on Android The organization of notes and folders is something I missed with Keep The options for formatting excel with this app and being able to use TeX is nice I just wish there was more in the way of security and a way to draw on notes The perfect app doesn't exist but this is pretty close
Pocket is underrated. I love it. Encrypt your notes and make use of Joplin plugins on desktop
Gr8 multiplatform app for note making... Little issue with encrypted sync (slow process) ....
Solid Evernote/Onenote alternative, to which I fully transitioned to.
Works well for my requirements. Joplin is my brain's extension, one of my most used apps on desktop. Android version is a suitable companion.
It's easy to create new note books. It's simple, effective and there are so many options. Definitely the best free note taking app!
It would be great if it supported a standard folder layout and .md files on the server side.

Initial sync on Android (only experience) does take a while, and can only sync when app is in the foreground. Apart from those, I'd give 5 stars. Excellent free note sharing app with cross compatibility.
omg! I love it so much it is free and it is very good for developers . super recommend
Not good
As other users mentioned, my Onedrive sync was broken too. What I did that resolved the issue was to delete app data and resync all from scratch. It worked for now.
Love it. Work perfectly with its desktop app.

I really don't understand the logic behind the Android client still not supporting create/move subnotebook a couple of years after it was added to the desktop client, after the GitHub issue was closed and locked, so it's impossible to comment there. This keeps the Android client crippled and is a show stopper for me: I can't use it at all without this feature. It's a pity because overall this is a great program.
No google drive integration!? Really!? Unnecessarily huge app for simple concept. There are numerous lightweight apps available with much lower app size
Excellent mobile companion to desktop Joplin. I wish I could filter tags while adding (I use too many tags to scroll). Start much faster than Evernote V10. Reliable and fully featured as desktop app.
üëç
Such a great app üëç
Should have switched from Evernote a long time ago
The best software I have ever used
We can't move notebooks and group them
We need widgets!!!! Please make widgets for android

Currently grinds to almost a standstill as note length becomes more than a few paragraphs. Something is not right here - I've never encountered a text editor that has problems with a few thousand characters not even when computers had less processing power than phones currently some ill-advised background task must be running amok. Promising but very buggy. My keyboard lags and is almost unusable when writing a note that is more than a paragraph long. Sync needs to be more frequent.
It became what I once hoped Evernote would become, but better in many ways I couldn't imagine back then.
Good, but not working after update.

Thanks so much for creating this wonderful, open-source app. I downloaded it mainly to get away from the privacy issues with some of the other apps I was using (particularly any google app). This is so much better than I expected. Love the multi device sync and ease of use.
Quite a lovely app. Could it be possible to add a reminders feature per note or to do list such that one gets a specific reminder with regard to each note or task list. Danke

A notable competitor to OneNote. I switched to Joplin and I don't regret it. It's really cool to have the same feature set on Linux and Windows.
Excellent so far. Has every feature that I used in other apps and is End to End encrypted. Fairly easy to set up. Highly recommended!

Best app. Very handy and works without any problems. It contains all the functions a professional note taking app have and even more. It has features even a premium app like Evernote cannot provide such as markdown support, Html support,mermaid diagrams and inline math formulas and syntax highlighted codeblocks. Great app but lack of shortcut bar... whatever that bar of buttons atop your keyboard that type in symbols or \t for you(look at Novelist for example) renders this unusable. I'm surprised all its users are comfortable writing markdown on a touch keyboard. Adding a to-do is way too painful; makes you wonder if the devs ever gave it a spin on a touch keyboard. It's has a lot of great ideas and I hate to put down FOSS but it'd be great if the devs worked more on ergonomics and making it accessible.

Best note taking app - ad free - Can backup your notes - Sync with dropbox or google drive. Cross platform . Can attach other files such as images, pdf, docs etc. Open source and in active development.
Great application, complementary to the Joplin desktop note editor. The only current downside is that editing becomes slow for long notes. I hope that this will be solved in the future.
Free and open source
Great work from the Dev, moved from Evernote and haven't looked back plus I control of my data now. The clients on my Linux, Android and iPad devices all function well together.
